meanings.definition: Adhering excessively to law or formula.
meanings.sent1: The legalistic teacher always followed the school rules to the letter.
meanings.sent2: The company's legalistic policies made it difficult for employees to think creatively.
meanings.sent3: The legalistic robot insisted on following every step in the instruction manual, even if it was unnecessary.
meanings.sent4: Her legalistic approach to cooking involved measuring every ingredient precisely.
meanings.sent5: The legalistic nature of the traffic laws ensured everyone drove safely.

meanings.definition: Overly concerned with rules and regulations.
meanings.sent1: His legalistic mindset made him question every minor detail in the contract.
meanings.sent2: The legalistic manager insisted on employees filling out paperwork for even the smallest tasks.
meanings.sent3: The legalistic cat refused to enter a room if it didn't meet its strict standards of cleanliness.
meanings.sent4: The legalistic clock never missed a beat, always following the schedule to the second.
meanings.sent5: The legalistic nature of the game made it challenging for players to think outside the box.
